newsitem.title: GHANA: Good half-year Mobil report buoys Ghana exchange.
newsitem.headline: Good half-year Mobil report buoys Ghana exchange.

text.p: A good interim report boosted Mobil Oil share values by 5.3 percent on Wednesday and helped lift Ghana stock indicators despite a 100-cedi fall by biggest equity Ashanti Goldfields, trading results showed.
The GSE All-Share Index rose 2.26 points to 375.20 and total market capitalisation rose to 3,265.93 billion cedis from 3,122.02 billion.
Dealers said Mobil Oil jumped 300 cedis to 6,000 on the strength of a good half-year report showing a 50 percent rise in turnover and a high interim dividend payout of 530 cedis.

Ghana Commercial Bank, the exchange's second biggest company, rose 12 cedis to 690. Social Security Bank ended three stronger at 1,010 cedis and Guinness Ghana, Pioneer Aluminium Factory and Metalloplastica rose two cedis apiece to 243, 145 and 137 cedis, respectively.
UTC-Estates was two down at 60 cedis. Ashanti finished at 29,800 cedis. Offers exceeded bids by 931,250 shares to 295,230 and a moderate 174,080 shares were traded.
